Comment:
Absolutely spot on, Rishabh! The way founders allocate their time really reflects the stage of the company and can make or break growth.

One thing that could also be highlighted is the balance between strategy and execution at each stage. For example, early-stage founders not only need to focus on product but also on validating the business model and market fit. Growth-stage founders, besides team and culture, need to ensure systems and processes scale effectively. Even at later stages, while capital and partnerships matter, maintaining customer empathy and feedback loops is often overlooked but critical for sustainable growth
